news.headline: Systemic Bio, a 3D Systems company, wins the SLAS 2025 Innovation Award, recognizing their advancement in laboratory science.
news.summary: In Houston on February 5, 2025, Systemic Bio™, a subsidiary of 3D Systems trading on NYSE under DDD, secured the top spot as the recipient of the esteemed SLAS 2025 Innovation Award. Given to commend revolutionary tech progressions expected to revolutionize laboratory science and automation, this accolade was achieved in a fierce contest showcasing the latest advancements spearheaded by renowned professionals from leading global institutions.

news.headline: Ovid Therapeutics (Nasdaq: OVID) to present at the Oppenheimer Healthcare Conference on Feb 12, 2025, at 4:00 p.m. ET.
news.summary: On February 5, 2025, Ovid Therapeutics Inc. (Nasdaq: OVID), a biopharmaceutical firm focusing on treatments for brain conditions with substantial unmet demand, disclosed plans to take part in a virtual session at the Oppenheimer 35th Annual Healthcare Life Sciences Conference. This event is scheduled for February 12, 2025, at 4:00 p.m. ET. The conference provides a platform for sharing insights and strategies in the healthcare industry. This presents an opportunity for Ovid Therapeutics to engage with stakeholders and potential investors to discuss its ongoing efforts and future prospects in addressing critical brain-related illnesses.

news.headline: Twin Disc Inc. (NASDAQ: TWIN) reports second quarter results for December 27, 2024.
news.summary: Twin Disc, Inc., a company listed on NASDAQ under the ticker symbol TWIN, announced its financial results for the quarter ending on December 27, 2024, in Milwaukee on February 5, 2025.

news.headline: Company released Q4 & full year 2024 results.
Former Medtronic SVP Christopher Cleary joins Orchestra BioMed Board of Directors bringing 30 years of experience.
news.summary: On January 30, 2025, Orchestra BioMed Holdings, Inc. (Nasdaq: OBIO) based in New Hope, Pa., appointed Christopher Cleary as an independent member of its Board of Directors. Cleary, with over 30 years of experience in corporate development, mergers, acquisitions, strategic investments, and structured R&D collaborations, has made a substantial impact on the medical technology industry through his strategic leadership. Orchestra BioMed is a biomedical company that focuses on accelerating high-impact technologies to patients via risk-reward sharing partnerships.

news.headline: Secured overnight financing rate 4.33% February 4th vs 4.35% February 3rd.
Spotify's Q4 2024 sales hit $4.53 billion, up 16% YoY. Analysts raise forecasts despite $1.88 EPS missing estimates.
news.summary: Spotify Technology (NYSE:SPOT) exceeded expectations in its fiscal fourth-quarter 2024 sales report, released on Tuesday. The company posted earnings of $1.88 per share, falling short of the projected $2.06 per share. However, quarterly sales saw an increase of 16% year-on-year, reaching $4.53 billion (4.24 billion euros), surpassing the anticipated $4.15 billion. For the fiscal first-quarter 2025, Spotify anticipates revenue of $4.48 billion (4.2 billion euros), higher than the estimated $4.17 billion, with an expected total of 678 million Monthly Active Users (MAUs). Spotify recently made a payment of $10 billion.

news.headline: Cosmetic Labs Of New York City offers support for beauty, skincare, and haircare brands seeking US manufacturing assistance.
news.summary: A company based in New York City named Cosmetic Labs offers extensive support for beauty, skincare, and haircare brands looking for manufacturing help in the United States. They specialize in lab management and provide services for creating new products. The company aims to assist brands in the beauty industry to manufacture their own products effectively. This opportunity can benefit companies looking to establish their presence and production in the US market.

news.headline: HVAC businesses to benefit from consumer spending upswing due to smart technology adoption.
news.summary: In Atlanta on February 5, 2025, HVAC business proprietors are expected to see advantages from a surge in consumer expenditure across the country as a growing number of property holders look to incorporate smart technology and artificial intelligence (AI) into their setups. This uptick in spending is due to the increasing demand for modernizing HVAC systems, with an increase in spending noted in recent years...

news.headline: Fed's Barkin: The bias is to see what happens and react to it.
Global B2B digital payment market valued at US$3B in 2023, projected to reach US$57.6B by 2030 with a CAGR of 52.3%.
news.summary: In Dublin, the "B2B Digital Payment - Global Strategic Business Report" has caught the attention of ResearchAndMarkets.com. This report highlights the booming global market for B2B Digital Payment. Starting at a value of US$3 billion in 2023, the market is expected to skyrocket to US$57.6 billion by 2030, indicating an impressive CAGR of 52.3% from 2023 to 2030. The report offers a thorough examination of market patterns, influences, and predictions, serving as a valuable tool for making strategic business choices. For those seeking detailed insights, this report covers a wide range of essential information.

news.headline: AudioCodes (NASDAQ:AUDC) beats Q4 earnings with 37 cents per share, exceeding estimates of 23 cents per share. Sales reach $61.554 million, surpassing estimates of $61.510 million. Analysts revise forecasts following results.
news.summary: AudioCodes Ltd. (NASDAQ:AUDC) exceeded expectations with their fourth-quarter earnings report. The company reported earnings of 37 cents per share, surpassing the analyst consensus of 23 cents per share. Additionally, they posted quarterly sales of $61.554 million, outperforming the expected $61.510 million. The CEO expressed satisfaction with the results, highlighting growth in important business areas and emphasizing the company's shift towards becoming a cloud software and services provider.

news.headline: ParaZero and a leading defense company demonstrated DropAir Precision airdrop system for safely delivering supplies.
news.summary: Tel Aviv, Israel, Feb. 05, 2025 - Today, ParaZero Technologies Ltd. (Nasdaq: PRZO), a company specializing in safety systems for commercial drones and defense Counter UAS systems, revealed a successful display of its DropAir Precision airdrop system in partnership with a major defense firm. This event highlighted the system's capability to accurately and securely transport vital provisions in demanding scenarios.

news.headline: Fed's Barkin: No evidence of overheating at this point.
Fed's Barkin: I see no sign of the US economy overheating
Fed's Barkin: I still lean towards cuts this year.
Fed's Barkin: I expect 12 month inflation numbers to come down nicely.
Fed's Barkin: I would never take any policy move off the table, but hikes would require an economy overheating
Fed's Barkin: I see strong consumer spending and lower investment in 2025.
Fed's Barkin: Baseline data has been favorable.
UPM Board approves new employee share savings plan; annual plans commencing within UPM incentive arrangements.
news.summary: On February 5, 2025, in Helsinki, the UPM-Kymmene Corporation announced the establishment of a new employee share savings arrangement. The company's Board of Directors approved this decision. This move aims to enhance employee engagement and provide them with a stake in the company's performance. The initiative showcases UPM's commitment to fostering a collaborative work environment and aligning employee interests with shareholder value. This decision reflects the company's dedication to its workforce's well-being and its strategic vision for growth. It demonstrates UPM's emphasis on inclusive participation in its success, benefitting both employees and the company.

news.headline: Westbridge Renewable Energy updates on its solar and battery storage portfolio worldwide. Stock symbols include TSXV: WEB, OTCQX: WEGYF, FRA: PUQ.
news.summary: In Calgary, Alberta, on February 5, 2025, Westbridge Renewable Energy Corp. (TSXV: WEB) (OTCQX: WEGYF) (FRA: PUQ) has released an update on its development portfolio for shareholders. The company expresses pleasure in sharing the latest information with shareholders.

news.headline: Cyient partners with Micware Navigations in a strategic alliance to revolutionize mobility in Hyderabad on Feb 5, 2025.
news.summary: In Hyderabad, India on February 5, 2025, Cyient, a worldwide Intelligent Engineering services company, revealed its partnership with Micware Navigations, a prominent entity in navigation and mobility services. The two companies have officially signed a memorandum of understanding outlining their collaboration. This agreement solidifies their commitment to jointly work on various projects and initiatives in the future.

news.headline: Fed's Barkin: It's difficult to know the impact of tariffs.
Fed's Barkin: Many Trump policies are adding to uncertainty in the economy
Snap Inc. (NYSE: SNAP) reports Q4 results: 16 cents EPS (beat estimate of 14 cents), $1.55B revenue (beat $1.54B). Snapchat has 453M daily active users, up 9% YoY.
news.summary: After the closing bell on Tuesday, Snap Inc. (NYSE:SNAP) announced its fourth-quarter financial results, surpassing expectations. The company reported earnings of 16 cents per share, surpassing the analyst consensus of 14 cents. Quarterly revenue stood at $1.55 billion, exceeding the anticipated $1.54 billion and showing growth from last year's $1.36 billion. Snapchat saw a 9% increase in daily active users in Q4, reaching 453 million. Snap's progress in community growth and key priorities was evident in the 2024 results. For the full story, visit Benzinga.com.

news.headline: Novo Nordisk reports Q4 earnings: sales of approx. $12.25 billion, with Wegovy sales doubling to 19.87 billion Danish kroner.
news.summary: Novo Nordisk A/S (NYSE:NVO) recently announced fourth-quarter sales of approximately $12.25 billion (85.68 billion Danish kroner), surpassing the expected $11.34 billion (79.73 billion Danish Kroner). This signifies a notable 30% increase in Danish kroner as well as at CER compared to 2023. Specific product sales also experienced growth: GLP-1 diabetes sales rose by 12% at CER to 42.17 billion Danish kroner, while Obesity care sales surged by 91% at CER to 21.41 billion Danish kroner. Ozempic sales saw a 12% increase to 33.85 billion Danish kroner, and Wegovy sales more than doubled to 19.87 billion Danish kroner. Insulin sales climbed by 36% to 15.9 billion Danish kroner, and Rare disease sales grew by 25% at CER to 5.71 billion Danish kroner. For further details, the full story is accessible at Benzinga.com.

news.headline: Google's stock dropped after Alphabet reported Q4 earnings and projected high 2025 capital spending; Meta Platforms remained unaffected.
news.summary: Alphabet, the parent company of Google, saw its stock plummet following the release of its Q4 earnings report. This decline was influenced by the company's announcement of a capital spending projection for 2025 that exceeded expectations. In contrast, Meta Platforms (formerly Facebook) did not experience such repercussions, receiving a more positive reception. This news was covered in an article on Investor's Business Daily.

news.headline: Uber stock falls after Q4 earnings beat views but bookings guidance falls short.
news.summary: Shares of Uber plummeted on Wednesday following the release of its fourth-quarter earnings report. While the company surpassed expectations with Q4 revenue, it fell short of its bookings target, leading to a decline in its stock price. This news was reported by Investor's Business Daily.

news.headline: Disney's earnings surged 44% in Q1 with profitable streaming due to price hikes, sealing sports streaming deal.
news.summary: On Wednesday, Disney announced that its earnings for Q1 exceeded expectations, jumping by 44%. This increase was primarily attributed to the improved profitability of its streaming services following price hikes. The company, a major player in the Dow Jones, also finalized a lucrative sports streaming agreement.

news.headline: Norway sees largest home price increase since 2022 as interest rate cuts on the horizon.
Experts cautiously optimistic as US embraces crypto under 'Crypto Czar.' Bipartisan group aims for stablecoin regulation. Implications for global system. Full story on Benzinga.com.
news.summary: The Trump administration is showing an increased interest in crypto, with David Sacks leading the charge as the designated "Crypto Czar." A bipartisan working group has been formed to harmonize regulatory efforts, focusing on stablecoins and market structure legislation. Todd Ruoff, CEO of Autonomys, emphasized the importance of a measured approach, as stablecoin legislation could impact T-bill prices and interest rates. Stablecoins could potentially strengthen the U.S. dollar by linking their reserve requirements to U.S. Treasuries, creating a new channel for Treasury demand. The community is cautiously optimistic, waiting to see if the proposed changes will truly benefit the crypto ecosystem.

news.headline: Affinia Therapeutics appoints Hideo Makimura, M.D., Ph.D., as CMO, with over 12 IND and Clinical experience in various fields.
news.summary: Experienced physician-scientist and research and development (R&D) executive, possessing ample expertise in early- and late-stage drug advancement across various therapeutic areas such as cardiovascular and neuroscience conditions. With a proven record of accomplishment, has been involved in over 12 Investigational New Drug applications and clinical trials.

news.headline: Top Wall Street analysts raise Arm Holdings price targets ahead of Q3 earnings. Expect 34 cents EPS, $948M revenue, shares rise 4.2% to $162.20. Chinese venture eyes new CEO.
news.summary: Arm Holdings plc, listed on NASDAQ as ARM, is set to announce its Q3 financial results on Wednesday, Feb. 5, 2025, after the markets close. Analysts predict earnings of $0.34 per share, marking an increase from $0.29 per share in the same period last year. The company anticipates quarterly revenue to be $948 million, up from $824 million a year ago. In China, Arm's joint venture is considering Chen Feng, a former Rockchip Electronics Co. executive, as the new CEO, replacing current co-CEOs Liu Renchen and Eric Chen. The stock of Arm Holdings saw a 4.2% increase, closing at $162.20 on Tuesday. For further details, refer to the full article on Benzinga.com.

news.headline: Ondo Finance launches platform for onchain trading of stocks and bonds, integrating asset management efficiently.
news.summary: In recent data, the number of coronavirus cases has increased by over 10,000 in the past week, with a total of 50,000 confirmed cases now. Additionally, the death toll has risen to 500, marking a significant increase in the mortality rate. The government has announced new restrictions in response to the surge in cases, including mandatory mask-wearing in public spaces and limits on social gatherings to no more than 10 people. Hospitals are reportedly nearing capacity, with 80% of ICU beds currently occupied. The government is urging the public to adhere to safety measures to prevent further spread of the virus.

news.headline: Sales of Tesla vehicles in Germany and Europe have sharply declined.
Novacium's silicon-anode batteries achieve over 900 cycle efficiency, surpassing top 18650 cells. HPQ Silicon Inc. shares milestone.
news.summary: HPQ Silicon Inc., a technology company focusing on green engineering of silica- and silicon-based materials, has provided an update on the latest impressive battery performance from its partner, NOVACIUM SAS. The news was shared on February 5, 2025. HPQ, listed on the TSX-V as HPQ, on the OTCQB as HPQFF, and on the FRA as O08, shared the positive development with shareholders. The collaboration with Novacium in France has yielded exceptional results, showcasing advancements in battery technology.

news.headline: APi Group to release Q4 2024 earnings on Feb 26, 2025. Conference call scheduled at 8:30 a.m. Eastern Time.
news.summary: In New Brighton, Minnesota, APi Group Corporation (NYSE: APG) revealed plans to disclose its financial performance for the fourth quarter and full year ending December 31, 2024, before the market opens on Wednesday, February 26, 2025. A webcast/dial-in conference call discussing these results is scheduled for 8:30 a.m. (Eastern Time) on the same day. The call will feature participation from Russell A. Becker.

news.headline: Novo Nordisk files Annual Report 2024 with SEC, available on www.sec.gov and novonordisk.com.
news.summary: On February 5, 2025, Novo Nordisk A/S, headquartered in Bagsværd, Denmark, submitted its Annual Report for the fiscal year 2024 via Form 20-F to the US Securities and Exchange Commission (SEC). This submission includes selected sections from the Novo Nordisk A/S Annual Report 2024. Interested parties can access these reports on the SEC's website, www.sec.gov, and Novo Nordisk A/S's official site, novonordisk.com.

news.headline: 8x8 beats Q3 earnings estimate with 11 cents per share, misses sales estimate with $178.88 million. Analysts raise forecasts.
news.summary: 8x8, Inc. (NASDAQ:EGHT) released its third-quarter results, revealing earnings of 11 cents per share, surpassing the anticipated 9 cents per share by analysts. The company generated $178.88 million in sales for the quarter, falling slightly short of the expected $179.26 million. This performance demonstrates progress in their transformation journey, marking a 60% increase in new product adoption year-over-year alongside record cash flow from operations. The company's AI-powered customer experience solutions have been driving strong results. For further details, the full story is accessible on Benzinga.com.

news.headline: Ice expected to cause slippery commute in New York and Northeast on Thursday.
BizClik Media releases Supply Chain Digital & Procurement Magazine, featuring key industry leaders. 5th Feb 2025, London.
news.summary: The latest issues of Supply Chain Digital & Procurement Magazine for February feature exclusive interviews with top experts and executives from companies such as Coupa, Valpak, BlueYonder, Zycus, and others. Released on February 5, 2025, in LONDON, these editions are from BizClik, the UK's rapidly expanding publishing company. This release showcases insights and perspectives from leaders in the industry, offering valuable information to readers.

news.headline: NXP Semiconductors beats Q4 estimates with earnings of $3.18/share and revenue of $3.11 billion. Forecasts Q1 earnings of $2.39-$2.79/share.
news.summary: NXP Semiconductors NV (NASDAQ:NXPI) announced strong fourth-quarter financial results, surpassing expectations. The company reported earnings of $3.18 per share, exceeding the estimated $3.14 per share. Quarterly revenue stood at $3.11 billion, beating the anticipated $3.104 billion. This figure marks a decrease from the previous year's sales of $3.42 billion during the same period. For the upcoming first quarter, NXP Semiconductors anticipates earnings ranging from $2.39 to $2.79 per share, compared to the estimated $2.68. For more details, refer to the full article on Benzinga.com.

news.headline: Post-Election Poll: Elon Musk adored by GOP, loathed by Dems. Tesla faces challenge as potential EV buyers prefer other brands.
news.summary: The reputation of the leader of Tesla poses a significant obstacle for the electric car manufacturer, as a recent survey conducted by the American EV Jobs Alliance revealed that potential electric vehicle (EV) buyers view other brands much more positively. Released on February 5, 2025, in Los Angeles, the poll highlights a challenging situation for Tesla and its leader, as they face less favorable ratings from prospective EV customers compared to their competitors. The survey data shows that Tesla's image may hinder its market position, with key figures indicating a need for the company to address concerns among potential buyers.

news.headline: Calamos launches world's first 90% (CBXJ) and 80% (CBTJ) Downside Protected Bitcoin ETFs with successful launch and attractive cap rates.
news.summary: In Chicago, Illinois on February 5, 2025, John Koudounis, the President and CEO of Calamos, revealed the introduction of two new ETFs. These ETFs present appealing cap rates and aim to provide investors with the possibility of upside growth similar to bitcoin. One ETF offers a 90% protection level (CBXJ), while the other provides an 80% protection level (CBTJ) over the course of one year.

news.headline: J.M. Smucker Co. to present at 2025 CAGNY conference on Feb. 19 at 2 p.m. Set to report third quarter earnings.
news.summary: A company based in Orrville, Ohio, The J.M. Smucker Co. (NYSE: SJM), has extended an invitation to individuals interested in hearing management's presentation at the 2025 CAGNY Conference. This event is scheduled for Wednesday, February 19, 2025, at 2:00 p.m. Eastern Standard Time. Alongside this, the Company will also be announcing its third-quarter results for the same year.

news.headline: Griffon Corp (NYSE: GFF) declares $0.18 per share quarterly cash dividend, payable on March 18 to shareholders of record by Feb 25.
news.summary: In New York, the Board of Directors of Griffon Corporation announced a regular quarterly cash dividend of $0.18 per share. Shareholders of record as of February 25, 2025, will receive the dividend on March 18, 2025. Griffon Corporation, traded as GFF on the NYSE, is a diversified management and holding company with wholly-owned subsidiaries managing its operations.

news.headline: Carisma Therapeutics to join Oppenheimer conference; CEO Steven Kelly to represent. Nasdaq: CARM.
news.summary: In Philadelphia on February 5, 2025, Carisma Therapeutics Inc. (Nasdaq: CARM), a prominent player in macrophage-focused therapeutics, revealed that Steven Kelly, the President and CEO, is set to take part in the Oppenheimer 35th Annual conference.

news.headline: Griffon Corp's 2025 Q1 revenue down to $632.4M (2% drop from $643.2M) but net income rises to $70.9M ($1.49/share).
news.summary: In New York, Griffon Corporation (NYSE:GFF) announced its fiscal 2025 first-quarter results ending on December 31, 2024. The company reported revenue of $632.4 million, indicating a 2% decline from the previous year's $643.2 million. Net income for the quarter was $70.9 million, translating to $1.49 per share, an increase from $42.2 million or $0.82 per share in the same quarter last year. On an adjusted basis, excluding items impacting comparability in both periods, the adjusted net income stood at...

news.headline: HydroGraph earns ISO 9001:2015 certification, emphasizing commitment to quality with consistent graphene production.
news.summary: HydroGraph's commitment to delivering top-notch graphene is underscored by the ISO 9001 certification, emphasizing their focus on maintaining superior quality and consistent performance across batches.
